intro: Medicago laciniata var. brevispina, commonly known as the narrow-spined catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats. It has a short, hairy stem and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
